security_audit.summary: All 57 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The analyzer misinterpreted markdown documentation code blocks as executable shell commands, and flagged placeholder comments and generic documentation as malicious patterns. The actual Python scripts are legitimate security tooling scaffolds with no malicious code, no network operations, and no unsanitized external command execution. This is a defensive security skill with safe, read-only scanning capabilities.

content.user_title: Automate security scanning and compliance checks
content.value_statement: Teams need systematic security validation across codebases but lack automated tooling for consistent vulnerability assessment. This skill provides three Python scripts for security scanning, vulnerability assessment, and compliance checking with configurable reporting and integration-ready output formats.
actual_capabilities: Execute security scanner to identify potential vulnerabilities in codebases
Run vulnerability assessor to analyze target paths and generate findings reports
Perform compliance checks against security standards and regulatory requirements
Generate JSON-formatted reports for integration with CI/CD pipelines
Validate target paths and file systems before analysis operations
Configure verbose output modes for debugging and detailed inspection
limitations: Scripts are scaffolding templates requiring actual security logic implementation
No built-in vulnerability database or threat intelligence integration
Limited to file system analysis without network security assessment
Does not perform penetration testing or exploit verification

use_cases.title: Automated security audits
use_cases.description: Schedule recurring security scans across codebases and generate compliance reports for audit cycles.

use_cases.title: CI/CD security gates
use_cases.description: Integrate security scanning into deployment pipelines to catch vulnerabilities before production release.

use_cases.title: Regulatory compliance checks
use_cases.description: Verify codebase compliance against security standards and generate documentation for audit purposes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Security Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the senior-secops skill to scan my project at [path] for security vulnerabilities. Run the security scanner with verbose output and generate a JSON report.

prompt_templates.title: Vulnerability Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Use senior-secops to perform a vulnerability assessment on [target-path]. Show me all findings with detailed explanations and severity levels.

prompt_templates.title: Compliance Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the compliance checker against [project-path] and output results as JSON. Include all compliance gaps and recommended remediation steps.

prompt_templates.title: Full Security Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a complete security review using senior-secops: run security scanner, vulnerability assessor, and compliance checker on [path]. Aggregate findings into a comprehensive report.

output_examples.input: Scan my codebase for security issues
output: Run with --verbose for detailed inspection of each finding.

output_examples.input: Check compliance for my API project
output: Recommendations: Review security_standards.md for best practices.

best_practices: Run security scans early in development cycles to catch issues before they accumulate
Integrate compliance checks into CI/CD pipelines as automated quality gates
Review generated reports and implement suggested remediation steps before deployment
anti_patterns: Deploying without running security scans assumes code is secure without validation
Ignoring compliance findings creates technical debt and audit risks
Using scans as a substitute for secure development practices rather than a supplement

faq.question: What languages does the security scanner support?
faq.answer: The scanner scaffolds are language-agnostic and can analyze any codebase structure.

faq.question: Can I integrate these scripts with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Yes, use --json output format and --output flag for machine-readable results in pipelines.

faq.question: Does this skill perform penetration testing?
faq.answer: No, this provides static analysis scaffolding. Penetration testing requires additional tools.

faq.question: How do I add custom security checks?
faq.answer: Modify the analyze() method in each script to implement your specific security logic.

faq.question: What compliance standards are supported?
faq.answer: The compliance checker is a template. Add specific standards to the compliance_requirements.md reference.

faq.question: Are the scripts safe to run on production systems?
faq.answer: Yes, scripts are read-only scanners that only write reports when explicitly requested.
